item.title: NeoDesk 4
item.description: Current version: Download NeoDesk 4.08 NeoDesk 4, the revolutionary replacement for the built-in Atari desktop, is now freeware. NeoDesk 4 adds hundreds of new features and enhancements over the original desktop, while remaining fully compatible with your other software applications. NeoDesk 4 is ideal for machines running a multitasking system (such as Geneva or MultiTOS) it also incorporates many of the features found in Geneva on singletasking systems, including 3D buttons, window gadgets, and popup menus.

item.title: Geneva
item.description: Current version: Download Geneva 1.08 The complete multitasking environment for all Atari ST/TT and Falcon computers. Before Geneva, the Atari was only able to load and run a single program at a time, and was only capable of using six desk accessories (without being forced to restart the computer). Based on the same concept of "co-operative" multitasking that the GEM environment was originally designed on, Geneva brings to the Atari a complete, easy to use, multitasking environment.

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) for Geneva
item.description: What’s the difference between preemptive and cooperative multitasking? Why can’t I use my boot manager to change resolutions? Why are the colors of some of my window gadgets messed up? Where can I get info on using MiNT with Geneva? What’s the difference between preemptive and cooperative multitasking? Cooperative multitasking relies on applications making certain calls frequently (in this case, AES calls) in order to allow the other processes a chance to become active.

item.title: Gribnif Software
item.description: Classic Atari ST/TT/Falcon Software Started in 1988, Gribnif Software produced various titles for the Atari ST line of computers. This site is dedicated to preserving two of those titles: NeoDesk 4, the desktop replacement, and Geneva, the multitasking environment. The site is maintained by Dan Wilga, the original author of the programs. News 2/11/2018: NeoDesk 4 and Geneva are now available as freeware in the Downloads section. We hope to make the source code available in the coming months.
